intro: Stipa × dzungarica, commonly known as the Dzungarian needlegrass, is a hybrid grass species native to Central Asia. It is characterized by its slender, cylindrical stems and dense, spike-like inflorescences. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as steppes and mountain slopes. Its leaves are narrow and坚韧, adapted to withstand arid conditions. Stipa × dzungarica plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing forage for grazing animals.
